result.execSummary:
The defendant Gabriel Ceballos was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes:
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Allowed to serve last half of the sentence on Home Monitor, if and only if, he qualifies.

miscConds.notes:
Pay costs including the Domestic Abuse Surcharge. 
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
No abusive contact with Maria Ceballos.

Complete the Domestic Abuse Alternatives Program, unless the agent finds he is not appropriate. 
Comply with any other counseling or assessment recommended by the agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Pay costs including the Domestic Abuse and DNA surcharges.
Comply with same conditions as ordered in Count 3.

records.addlTxt: Disbursements Journal Final

Defendant Gabriel Ceballos in court with attorney Richard E. Bender. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
9:16 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of:  Counts 3 & 4: NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Counts 3 & 4 as Domestic Abuse Incidents.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Counts 1 & 2 are dismissed and read-in. 

State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.  Victim Impact Statement has been filed.
Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Bender makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Count 3 - 
Serve 9 months in jail - STAYED -
3 days credit
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Allowed to serve last half of the sentence on home monitor, if and only if, he qualifies. 
Placed on probation for a period of 18 months: 
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Complete the Domestic Abuse Alternatives Program, unless the agent finds he is not approrpiate.
Comply with any other counseling or assessment recommended by the agent. 
No abusive contact with Maria Ceballos.
Maintain fulltime employment. 
Pay costs including the Domestic Abuse surcharge. 

Count 4 - 
Serve 90 days, consecutive to Count 3.  STAYED
Placed on probation for a period of 18 months:
Comply with same conditions as ordered in Count 3. 
Pay costs including the Domestic Abuse surcharge and the DNA surcharge.
